meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I ould go to the park with my friends.
meanings.sent2: She ould finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent3: If I ould fly like a bird, I would visit all the countries in the world!
meanings.sent5: The memory of her smile ould warm his heart on cold days.

meanings.definition: Used to express possibility or ability
meanings.sent1: I ould possibly finish the puzzle by tonight.
meanings.sent2: She ould easily lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: If I ould run as fast as a cheetah, I would win every race!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter ould brighten even the gloomiest days.
meanings.sent5: The idea of exploring the unknown ould excite him beyond measure.

meanings.sent1: My ould always tell the best stories about our family history.
meanings.sent2: She learned a lot about her ould during the family reunion.
meanings.sent3: The portrait of his ould hanging on the wall seemed to watch over the room.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the family tree ould stretch far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The traditions passed down from his ould were cherished and honored.

meanings.definition: A type of grain or cereal crop
meanings.sent1: The farmer harvested the ripe ould from the fields.
meanings.sent2: She baked delicious bread using the finest ould.
meanings.sent3: The golden color of the ould fields shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The fields of ould swayed gently in the breeze like a sea of gold.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked ould bread filled the kitchen with warmth.
